none: Mundane resources or objects with no special attributes.
superior: Resources or objects slightly improved in relevant aspects, including durability, crafting efficacy, attack, defense, and more.
remarkable: A quality which provides a notable enhancement to relevant aspects including durability, crafting efficacy, attack, defense, and more.
exceptional: Resources or objects with very substantial improvements to relevant aspects, likely to contain a spark of magic.
mastercrafted: Perfected crafts, excelling in all aspects, bestowed with many magics.
relic: Extremely rare and sought after due to their potent magics, but very brittle due to their age. Given the requisite reagents, the potency of relic magic could likely be increased further than for lesser qualities.

modStarterQuestResourceGathering:
Now that you have action slots sorted out, you can try gathering some resources.

Make sure if you are using an item in your action slot, that its action is set to "{/Chop/}" or "{/Mine/}".

Find maple trees to gather the branches. Find gray-colored mountains to gather the granite.
modStarterQuestCrafting:
To survive, you will need to craft new items from the resources you gather. Press {BINDINGS:DialogCrafting} to open the crafting window. It will show you what you can make from the items in your inventory. Start by making sharp granite which is used in many crafting recipes. Not every attempt to craft an item is successful, and the chance of success depends on the skill level of the item against your crafting skills.

If your crafting menu is too small, you can adjust it in size and position by dragging it around or dragging the corners to resize.
modStarterQuestDismantle:
Not all items are crafted, some are dismantled from other items. A branch for example can be dismantled into twigs, leaves, stripped bark, and a wooden pole; a wealth of resources.

Dismantling items can be done through the crafting menu by clicking on the "{/Dismantle/}" tab. You will see a listing of items that can be dismantled. Hovering over each will show what they will be dismantled into. Alternatively, you can dismantle items using {BINDINGS:GameItemMenu} on them in your inventory and selecting "{/Dismantle/}".
modStarterQuestHunting: It's time to learn another important survival lesson: Hunting! Find a creature with meat and slay it. You can butcher its corpse after dealing the final blow, using a "{/Sharpened/}" item while facing it by using "{/Butcher/}" from the item's menu. You can also assign it to an action slot and use a bind to do this quicker. Creatures with some form of raw meat include giant rats, giant spiders, chickens, rabbits, and more.
modStarterQuestWoodenPoles: You will need to start a fire to cook the raw meat if you want to eat it safely. Your first order of business is to gather the materials used to create your fire-making device. Dismantling logs, then dismantling the wooden planks it makes will get you enough "{/Wooden Poles/}" to do this.
modStarterQuestHandDrill: At this point, you will have unlocked a new crafting recipe called "{/Hand Drill/}", a primitive and easy-to-craft device that makes fire. You unlock new crafting recipes by having one of each required items in your inventory. Go ahead and craft it!
modStarterQuestKindlingTinder:
The final items needed to start a fire are kindling and tinder. Many items are considered kindling, such as twigs, tree bark, and wooden dowels (dismantled from wooden poles). Many items are also considered tinder, such as wooden shavings (dismantled from twigs or wooden dowels), animal fur, leaves, and more.

Craft, dismantle, or find kindling and tinder!
modStarterQuestCampfire:
You could technically start a fire at this moment. But to make a proper, enclosed fire-source, you'll want to make a "{/Granite Campfire/}". You'll need quite a few pieces of granite for this endeavor.

With some items, you will be able to build them and temporarily affix them to the world. These objects that are attached/placed on tiles, are called "{/Doodads/}". Using {BINDINGS:GameItemMenu} on the campfire in your inventory will give you the option to "{/Build/}" it. Do so now, facing a valid tile.
modStarterQuestFire:
With your hand drill, select the "{/Start Fire/}" option from the item's menu while facing the campfire. Doing so will create a fire contained inside of it. You don't always get lucky when making a fire with low camping skills. It's possible that you may need to re-gather and craft some more wooden shavings (or any other tinder item, such as, leaves, animal fur, or grass blades) and kindling if you fail too many times.

Be careful not to step in your fire!
modStarterQuestStokeFire:
Your fire could probably use more fuel as well. To add fuel to a fire, use {BINDINGS:GameItemMenu} on an item and choose the "{/Stoke Fire/}" action. This action is available on many items, including logs, branches, and more.

You can check the status of the fire by hovering your mouse over it. If you have tool-tips disabled, you can also check the status by using {BINDINGS:GameInspect} while hovering over it.
modStarterQuestCooking:
Now that you have a proper fire going, you can cook the meat! The crafting recipe will be unlocked for the cooked form of this meat. You can even eat it after you are done if you are hungry, or save it for later.

Cooking equipment may required for this endeavor. Cooking equipment is an item grouping that contains a wide variety of items including branches, wooden poles, spears, tongs, and more!
modStarterQuestPurifyingFreshWater:
Now that you're fed, what about your hydration levels? Most of the world is water, but unfortunately, it's not in a drinkable form. It's far easier to seek out fresh water instead of trying to desalinate the seawater around you. If you still have a container of water in your inventory, you can drink it now. We're going to purify some more now.

If you found any fresh water tiles while exploring so far, go to them and fill up your container of water. If not, head back to your starting area - there should be a bit of fresh water available nearby.

Use {BINDINGS:GameItemMenu} on your empty water container and choose the "{/Gather Water/}" action. when facing fresh water.

Next, go back to your fire and stoke or light it back on fire if you have to, then craft the purified fresh water while next to the fire. This is how you purify the fresh water you find around the island.
modStarterQuestTaming:
Have you encountered a hostile creature yet? Being counter-aggressive to hostile island creatures is sometimes not the best option, especially if you are ill-prepared or ill-equipped. There are multiple ways to tame a creature. The most effective way to tame a creature and have it fight for you is to keep them fed and happy. To accomplish this, you can do one of the following actions:

1. Facing a creature, choose the "{/Offer/}" from an item's menu. Certain creatures will like different items. You may have to experiment with this.
2. Drop an item on the ground and have the creature walk over it. If they want the item, they will become tamed.
3. Facing a creature, open the actions menu with {BINDINGS:GameActions} and choose "{/Tame/}". Taming in this manner is difficult, especially at lower skill levels.
modStarterQuestExtraStorage:
Feeling a bit heavy? You may want to start thinking about long-term storage that is outside of your inventory. The easiest storage container to craft is a "{/Wooden Chest/}". You will need to get both wooden planks and wooden dowels. To get wooden dowels, you will need to dismantle wooden poles, which are first dismantled from branches or wooden planks. To get wooden planks, you will need to dismantle logs.

If you are looking for further weight reduction in your inventory, you may consider crafting bags or backpacks (using leather) to reduce inventory weight for all items that are kept inside them.
modStarterQuestDripstone:
Fresh water may be limited. You might have to desalinate seawater eventually and this quest will teach you how. Gather the following resources to be able to craft a "{/Granite Dripstone/}".

After gathering all those resources, you can craft the dripstone. You'll use this device to pour the seawater into to filter into drinkable water.

Just like with the campfire previously, you'll be able to "{/Build/}" the dripstone facing a valid tile from the item's menu.
modStarterQuestFillDripstone:
To test out your new dripstone, grab some water from the sea. With an empty container in your inventory, choose the "{/Gather Water/}" option while facing seawater with your container.

Next, while facing the dripstone, choose the "{/Pour/}" option from your container of seawater's item menu. This will pour the liquid into the top of the dripstone.
modStarterQuestGatherLiquid:
The process of filtering seawater through the dripstone will take some time. You can do some other tasks or explore the island while you wait. It will take approximately 1500 turns before it is ready. You can tell it's done when the water is in the bottom vessel.

When the process has completed, you can choose the "{/Drink in Front/}" actions by pressing {BINDINGS:GameActions} while facing the dripstone. Alternatively, if you have an empty container, you can choose the "{/Gather Liquid/}" option from the container's item menu.

Desalination is only needed if you run out of fresh water sources which can be quite abundant via mountain rivers or ponds around the island.
modStarterQuestSurvivalistTraining:
That's it! You should now have some basic knowledge on how to survive in Wayward. With enough learning and skill, you'll eventually be able to thrive and prosper.

Treasure, you remember something about treasure...

chemistry:
- Influences quality and success rate of crafting items using chemical mixtures.

 - Adds ability to detect crafted quality chances, mastercraft chances, and crafting efficacy with increasing accuracy when crafting items using chemical mixtures.
anatomy:
- Increases accuracy of creature health, resistance, and vulnerability descriptions.
 - Decreases chance of bleeding, poisoning, and burning pain from creatures.
 - Increases accuracy of status effect tooltip descriptions.
 - Increases effectiveness of healing consumables.
 - Increases success chance when healing.
 - Decreases chance of bleeding when using bare hands during combat or gathering.
 - Increases the amount of resources butchered at a time.
 - Increases effectiveness of eating raw meat.
marksmanship: - Increases attack damage, accuracy, and maximum range when using bows and firearms.
blacksmithing:
- Influences quality and success rate of crafting items using metal.
 - Increased chance of successfully repairing, reinforcing, and refining metal items.
 - Adds ability to detect crafted quality chances, mastercraft chances, and crafting efficacy with increasing accuracy when crafting items using metal.
botany:
- Decreases chance of trampling plants when stepping on them.
 - Increases chance of gathering/harvesting resources on plants.
 - Increases the quality of resources gathered/harvested from trees and plants.
 - Decreases chance of stamina reduction while gathering/harvesting from plants.
 - Decreases chance of damaging the plant when harvesting or gathering from it.
 - Decreases seed germination time.
 - Increases the amount of resources gathered/harvested at a time.
 - Increases effectiveness of eating plant-based consumables.
 - Increased chance of successfully preserving, and refining plant-based items.

 - Increases the accuracy of telling the time with a sundial.
 - Increases the effectiveness of extinguishing open fires with the smother action.

cartography:
- Increases the range in which you can dig or cast to gather treasure from.

 - Increases the success rate of copying and drawing maps.

 - Increases the chance of successfully catching a fish without bait.
fletching:

glassblowing:
- Influences quality and success rate of crafting items using glass.
 - Increased chance of successfully reinforcing, and refining glass items.

leatherworking:
- Influences quality and success rate of crafting items using leather.
 - Increased chance of successfully repairing, reinforcing, and refining leather items.
 - Adds ability to detect crafted quality chances, mastercraft chances, and crafting efficacy with increasing accuracy when crafting items using leather.
lockpicking:
- Increases chance to successfully unlock a chest.
 - Influences quality and success rate of crafting lockpicks.
 - Increased chance of successfully repairing, reinforcing, and refining lockpicks.
 - Adds ability to detect crafted quality chances, mastercraft chances, and crafting efficacy with increasing accuracy when crafting lockpicks.
lumberjacking:
- Increases chance of gathering resources on trees.
 - Increases the quality of resources gathered from trees.
 - Decreases chance of stamina reduction while lumberjacking.
 - Increases the amount of resources gathered at a time.
 - Decreases the failure rate when gathering logs.

stonecrafting:

swimming:

tinkering:
- Influences quality and success rate of crafting items using miscellaneous resources and methods.

trapping:
- Increases the amount of damage and success rate of trapping creatures with traps.
 - Increases the success rate of trapping untamed creatures in cages.

woodworking:
- Influences quality and success rate of crafting items using wood.
 - Increased chance of successfully repairing, reinforcing, and refining wooden items.
 - Adds ability to detect crafted quality chances, mastercraft chances, and crafting efficacy with increasing accuracy when crafting items using wood.
taming:
- Increases chance of successfully taming a creature.
 - Increases length of time creature will be tamed for.
 - Decreases chance of stamina reduction when taming/offering/milking/hitching/petting.
 - Decreases amount of happiness reduced when milking goats.
 - Increases chance of taming when offering an aberrant creature items.
 - Increased chance of hitching aberrant or untamed creatures.
 - Increases effectiveness of petting creatures to increase happiness and other bonus effects.
 - Adds ability to detect additional information about tamed creatures.
 - As skill increases, more creature commands become available.
horticulture:
- Increases the durability (or health) of sown plants or mushrooms.
 - Decreases growth time when watering plants or mushrooms.
 - Increases chance of successfully tilling.
 - Decreases chance of stamina reduction while tilling.
 - Influences quality and success rate of crafting items requiring horticulture skill.
 - Increased chance of successfully refining items requiring horticulture skill.
 - Adds ability to detect crafted quality chances, mastercraft chances, and crafting efficacy with increasing accuracy when crafting items requiring horticulture skill.
bartering: - Influences the amount of barter credit received or used when trading items.
seafaring:
- Allows traveling to further islands in a single trip.
 - Reduces the stamina cost of encumbrance while paddling.
 - Reduces the time it takes to travel between islands, thereby reducing the hunger and thirst gained on the voyage, the damage dealt to the boat, and the amount that items decay.
thaumaturgy:
- Increased chance of successfully transmogrifying, enchanting, enhancing, upgrading, and altering items.
 - Decreases chance of stamina reduction while transmogrifying/enchanting/enhancing/upgrading/altering items.
dualWielding:
- Increases additional damage from wielding a second weapon in your off hand.
 - Decreases chance of extra stamina reduction while dual wielding.
theurgy:
- Improves the results of invoking some rune types.
 - Decreases the time required before a deity can be invoked again.
 - Increases chance of receiving runes from deities.

health:
Your physical wellbeing.
- Your health falling to zero will spell your demise.
- Many negative statuses can directly impact your health, but {#--TEXT-PRIMARY:each of them can be cured}.
stamina:
The energy you have to perform actions.
- Nearing zero {#--COLOR-WARNING:{$STATUS:EXHAUSTED:tires}} you, slowing your movement.
- Reaching zero {#--COLOR-BAD:{$STATUS:EXHAUSTED:exhausts}} you. Performing actions while exhausted strains your body and deals {$STAT:HEALTH:damage}!
- Stamina can be recovered over time, by resting, or with some consumable items.
hunger:
Your desperation for food.
- Many items can be eaten, but {#--TEXT-PRIMARY:only some are entirely safe}. Testing foods reveals their effects on your stats.
- Reaching negative values begins {#--COLOR-BAD:{$STATUS:STARVING:starvation}}, dealing equivalent {$STAT:HEALTH:damage}!
thirst:
Your desperation for water.
- Salt water can be safely consumed if distilled.
- Fresh water can always be consumed, but {#--TEXT-PRIMARY:may contain harmful miasma if not purified}.
- Reaching negative values begins {#--COLOR-BAD:{$STATUS:DEHYDRATED:dehydration}}, dealing equivalent {$STAT:HEALTH:damage}!
weight:
The burden you carry.
- Nearing your weight limit {#--COLOR-WARNING:{$STATUS:ENCUMBERED:encumbers}} you, and increases your {$STAT:THIRST} rate.
- Exceeding your weight limit {#--COLOR-BAD:{$STATUS:ENCUMBERED:overburdens}} you, each movement draining your {$STAT:STAMINA}.
attack:
The damage you will deal to your opponents.
- Damage is equal to your {$SKILL:TACTICS} + your {#--TEXT-PRIMARY:weapon's attack value} + any {#--TEXT-PRIMARY:vulnerabilities} \- any {#--TEXT-PRIMARY:resistances}.
- More damage types on a weapon means it fills a more niche role, as it is more likely that creatures will resist, be immune from, or even regenerate from that damage.
- Creatures' vulnerabilities and resistances can be discovered by using various damage types against them.
defense:
Your protection from opponents and the elements.
- Damage dealt to you is equal to the {#--TEXT-PRIMARY:enemy's attack} \- your {#--TEXT-PRIMARY:base defense} \- your {$SKILL:PARRYING} skill (with equipment in both hands) + any {#--TEXT-PRIMARY:vulnerabilities} \- any {#--TEXT-PRIMARY:resistances}.
metabolism:
Your body's efficiency; extending the time before hunger and thirst take hold.
- Increases time before {$STAT:THIRST:dehydration} and {$STAT:HUNGER:starvation}.
strength:
The raw muscle to endure punishment and carry heavy burdens with ease.
- Increases maximum {$STAT:HEALTH} and {$STAT:WEIGHT:carry weight}.
curse:
As night is struck, strange things begin to occur...
- Your curse is determined by your hold over the island.
- During the night, there may be one or more curse events. The greater your curse, the greater the chance of these events.
- {#--TEXT-PRIMARY:Sleeping prevents curse events.}
- As dawn breaks, any strangeness from events will fade.
dexterity:
Swift precision of movements to maximize your endurance.
- Increases maximum {$STAT:STAMINA}

poisoned: You feel nauseous as you writhe in pain.
burned: Your skin is raw and inflamed.
encumbered: You are carrying too much weight.
starving: You feel empty and lethargic as your body begins to consume itself.
dehydrated: Your throat is parched, your mouth is dry, and your head aches.
overheating: The temperature is too warm; your skin is sticky with sweat and your throat is quick to parch.
freezing: The temperature is too cold; your extremities are going numb as your body struggles to stay warm.
frostbitten: You feel the sharp, cold pain of frozen extremities.
frenzied: Its hostility is swift and relentless!

dynamic: Attempt to dynamically position the keyboard based on where the input is located on screen.
top: Always position the keyboard along the top of the screen.
bottom: Always position the keyboard along the bottom of the screen.

fire: A dangerous open flame providing heat and light.
honeyFungus: A parasitic tree fungus that can grow and spread on living, decaying, and dead plant material.
tumblingTumbleweed: A dry and brittle tumbling weed, broken off from its roots and spreading seeds in its meandering path.
animalDroppings: Droppings produced by a small mammal.
birdDroppings: Droppings produced by some winged creature.
animalDung: A seemingly fresh pile of feces, excreted from an animal.
guano: The excrement of a bat, thought to be used as fertilizer.
wispDust: A quickly vanishing pile of glowing dust, excreted from a ghostly wisp.
acid: A neon-green ooze; boiling and bubbling into the ground.
slimePatch: A smear of gooey slime with an ungodly green hue.

ui.menuAboutGameDescription: Wayward is a challenging turn-based, top-down, wilderness survival roguelike. Explore, build, and most importantly, survive in these unforgiving lands.
ui.menuAboutTextSpecialThanksTestorsAndDona: An extra special thank you to all the early testers, donators, and other supporters.
ui.menuAboutSectionLibrariesDescription: Wayward is made possible with the following projects:
ui.menuBindingsDescription: Configure the bindings for all of the game's actions.
ui.menuChangelogDescription: View major and minor updates to Wayward.
ui.menuChangelogFailedToLoadDescription: Either something went wrong, or you're in no-man's land.
ui.menuCharacterSelectionDescription: Randomize a new character or create from a template.
ui.menuDevelopmentBranchStatusUnavailable: Unable to get the current development branch status. :(
ui.menuErrorReportingTitle: Automatically send error reports to the Wayward team
ui.menuErrorReportingContentsDescription:
Any error reports sent are {/completely/} stripped of {/all/} context. They contain nothing connecting to you, your computer, or your save files. An error report sent from your game, on your machine, will be entirely equivalent to the same error sent by someone else's game on their machine.

As an example, we might get a report that says {.CODE:Error: Cannot read property 'x' of undefined}. The only thing we can see beyond that is what part of the code that error came from.
ui.menuMultiplayerDescription: Join your companions on their adventures.
ui.menuMultiplayerButtonJoinById: Join by Game Code or IP
ui.menuHelpDescription: Information, guides, and other help for playing Wayward.
ui.menuHighscoresDescription: See how well you did in your past adventures.
ui.menuLoadGameDescription: Continue a past game, or create a new game.
ui.menuMainButtonModsAllDisabled: All mods have been disabled due to the version change.
ui.menuModsWarningModsDisabledDescription: You have updated to a new major version of Wayward. To prevent potential issues, all mods have been preemptively disabled.
ui.menuModsDescription: Manage installed mods and publish your own.
ui.menuModsSubmenuEditInternalModsDescripti: Edit the list of internal mods.
ui.menuNewGameDescription: Create a new world with your choice of settings.
ui.menuNewGameChoiceMultiplayerDescription: Allow friends to join your world. Limited to real-time turns mode.
ui.menuNewGameChoiceTurnModeManualDescripti: Turns only pass as players perform actions (also known as "turn-based").
ui.menuNewGameChoiceTurnModeRealTimeDescrip: Turns happen automatically as time passes.
ui.menuNewGameChoiceTurnModeSimulatedDescri: Turns happen automatically as long as player(s) are performing actions.
ui.menuNewGameChoiceDifficultyChallengeDail: A randomized challenge every day, that everyone around the world will have the chance to play!
ui.menuNewGameButtonMilestonesDescription: Enable and disable benefits and new challenges unlocked via the completion of milestones.
ui.menuNewGameMilestoneModifiersUnlockableI: {#--TEXT-SECONDARY:{1?{0} mode has {#--TEXT-PRIMARY:{1} milestone {PLURAL({1})modifier}} left to unlock.:You have unlocked all milestone modifiers available in {0} mode.}}
ui.menuNewGameChoiceClientsInheritHostModif: All clients will inherit the chosen modifiers below. For instance, if choosing the 'Friendly' modifier, all players will start with a tamed creature, regardless of whether they have the milestone themselves.
ui.menuNewGameChoiceCustomModifiersDescript: All clients will be able to choose their own modifiers when joining the server.
ui.menuMilestoneModifiersDescription: Add benefits or extra challenges to this game.
ui.menuCustomGameOptionsDescription: Customize how the game will play.
ui.menuCustomGameOptionsRespawnOnDeathDescr: Players will respawn when they die.
ui.menuCustomGameOptionsApplyTravelingEffec: Determines whether players lose stamina and gain hunger/thirst when traveling to other islands.
ui.menuCustomGameOptionsCreaturesDisableSca: If checked, creatures will no longer run away from the player due to fear, health, or other mechanics (like flying away during the day for bats).
ui.menuCustomGameOptionsCreaturesAberrantSp:
Whether the game should spawn tougher versions of creatures.
{#--TEXT-SECONDARY:Currently set to:} {0}
ui.menuCustomGameOptionsCreaturesSpawnLimit: Limit the amount of creatures that can spawn on map generation or randomly.
ui.menuCustomGameOptionsCreaturesSpawnRateM: Scales the rate at which creatures will spawn. The higher this value, the faster the spawning will be.
ui.menuCustomGameOptionsEternalNightDescrip: The moon will never set; the sun will never rise.
ui.menuCustomGameOptionsEternalDayDescripti: The sun will never set; the moon will never rise.
ui.menuCustomGameOptionsTimeDayLengthToolti: The number of turns/ticks in a day.
ui.menuCustomGameOptionsTimeDayPercentToolt: A number representing how much of the day is "daytime" and, inversely, how much of the day is {/not/} "night time".
ui.menuCustomGameOptionsStatusPassChanceMul: When {0}, scales the chance of the negative effect passing.
ui.menuCustomGameOptionsStatusUntreatableTo: Whether this status effect is untreatable - if checked, the effect must pass naturally.
ui.menuCustomGameOptionsSkillInitialRandomC: The random starting skills may be overwritten by custom starting skills.
ui.menuCustomGameOptionsSkillMultiplierTool: Scales the rate at which this skill is gained.
ui.menuCustomGameOptionsRandomItemsDescript: If disabled, players will spawn in the world without starting items.
ui.menuCustomGameOptionsItemDecayTooltip: Scales item decay (for example, how long food lasts) globally. Higher values will make items have a higher lifespan.
ui.menuCustomGameOptionsViewGroundItemsAsCo: Allows viewing a dialog for interacting with items on the ground, as if they were in a real container.
ui.menuNewsDescription: Find information pertaining to the game and its updates.
ui.menuOptionsButtonHealthVignetteTooltip: If checked, the red vignetting effect displayed when at low health will not be shown.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDisplayArticleInObjectN: By default, object names include an article. For instance, "A Branch" or "An Aberrant Wolf". Disabling this option removes the article, resulting in "Branch" and "Aberrant Wolf".
ui.menuOptionsButtonSaveDataBackupsTooltip: Backs up the last 5 saves to the backup folder.
ui.menuOptionsButtonTracingRecordingTooltip:
Records performance trace files to the logs folder. Useful for debugging performance issues.
Note: These files can get very large very fast. Try not to record for too long.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDropLocationFeetWhenFac: Drop Items at Feet When Facing Tile is Blocked
ui.menuOptionsHeadingGameplayOptionsDescrip: These settings are located in the Gameplay Settings dialog for easy access.
ui.menuOptionsTooltipTurnDelay: The amount of movement delay that occurs after switching a direction or turning.
ui.menuOptionsTooltipMouseTurnDelay: The amount of movement delay that occurs after switching a direction or turning when using your mouse.
ui.menuOptionsTooltipControlsFilter: Filter the game's bindable actions. You can do multiple selections at once with a comma {#--TEXT-SECONDARY:({#--COLOR-BIND:,})} and invert a selection by prefixing it with an exclamation point {#--TEXT-SECONDARY:({#--COLOR-BIND:!})}
ui.menuOptionsBindChoose: Press anything to choose the replacement binding.
ui.menuOptionsBindChooseAdd: Press anything to choose an additional binding.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDiscoverEverythingDescr: Much of Wayward's gameplay is about experimentation, exploration, and discovery. As such, many details, and even some UI components and options are hidden until you've "discovered" them. This option allows disabling this discovery system  though be warned, seeing everything can be overwhelming, and also take some of the fun out of the game!
ui.menuOptionsButtonGrantAllMilestoneModifi: Wayward's achievement system, "Milestones", comes with "modifiers" that can be added to subsequent saves, granting bonuses or spicing up gameplay. This option allows you to apply those modifiers to a game without first completing the milestone.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDisableMilestonesDescri: Say you want to test something. Maybe it's a mod that gives you some cheaty stuff... Maybe you want to messing around with Debug Tools or the console... Maybe you're playing with milestone modifiers unlocked for a bit... Whatever reason you may have, you can use this option to prevent milestone progress while you're not playing the game normally.
ui.menuOptionsButtonAllowAlternatingDirecti: If checked, you will move in alternating directions when two directions are pressed or diagonal angles are used with the mouse.
ui.menuOptionsButtonAlwaysShowMoreInformati: If checked, you will never have to hold down a key to show more information in tooltips.
ui.menuOptionsButtonEnableLowPowerModeToolt: If checked, the game will try to use less system resources.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDisableAcrylicTranspare: If checked, transparent elements  such as tooltips, dialogs, and interrupt screens  will no longer blur what's under them, possibly reducing GPU and CPU load on some devices.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDisableOverlaySupportTo: If checked, overlay support will be disabled which will reduce GPU load, but will stop external program overlays and the Steam Overlay from functioning properly.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDisableUIEffectsTooltip: If checked, animations and other effects on the UI will be disabled, possibly reducing GPU and CPU load on some devices.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDisableUIOpacityTooltip: If checked, opacity (transparency) will be disabled on UI elements, possibly reducing GPU and CPU load on some devices.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDisableMovementAnimatio: If checked, movement animations will be disabled, possibly reducing GPU and CPU load on some devices.
ui.menuOptionsButtonAutoAttackTooltip: If checked, you will automatically attack when moving into a creature or player (with PVP enabled) with whichever hand(s) you have selected.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDropOnDismantleTooltip: If checked, you will automatically drop items under your character when dismantling items.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDropOnDisassembleToolti: If checked, you will automatically drop items under your character when disassembling items.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDisableCraftingProtecte: Disable Crafting with Protected Required Items
If checked, protected required items will not be used in crafting at all. Consumed protected items will never be used in crafts regardless of what this option is set to.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDropOnGatherHarvestTool: If checked, you will automatically drop items under your character as you chop/mine/harvest/dig them.
ui.menuOptionsButtonUseAdjacentContainersTo: If checked, items in adjacent containers or tiles can be used in crafting and other actions.
ui.menuOptionsButtonHideEquippedHeadgearToo: If checked, equipped headgear on your character will not be visible to you.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDisableItemNotifiersToo: If checked, item notifiers will not be displayed overhead when items are damaged, picked up, moved, etc.
ui.menuOptionsButtonLeftHandedTooltip: If checked, your main hand slot will display on your character's left hand.
ui.menuOptionsButtonDropIntoContainersToolt: If checked, when facing a container, items will be dropped into the container instead of onto the ground.
ui.menuOptionsButtonWarnOnDangerousActionsT: If checked, a confirmation screen will display when crafting, gathering, or resting with items that are on fire and could burn you.
ui.menuOptionsButtonWarnOnDroppingActionsTo: If checked, a confirmation screen will display when attempting dump or drop multiple items into water or the void.
ui.menuOptionsButtonWarnOnDestructiveAction: If checked, a confirmation screen will display when attempting to gather plants that will not produce any resources yet.
ui.menuOptionsButtonWarnWhenBreakingItemsOn: If checked, a confirmation screen will display when trying to craft/dismantle using items that will break on use or failure.
If checked, a confirmation screen will display when trying to use damaged items that may break on use.
ui.menuOptionsTooltipDialogOpacity: Controls how opaque the in-game dialogs are.
ui.menuOptionsDeveloperUIExperimentsDescrip: New work-in-progress UI functionality. Use at your own risk  these experimentations may cause catastrophic errors! Only enable these if you know what you're doing.
ui.menuOptionsDeveloperDebuggingDescription: Want to help us out? You can turn these options on and off to help us track down issues.
ui.menuOptionsDeveloperToggleContainerDesyn:
Sometimes, the new container UI can desync from its internal representation. When this happens, the item list must be regenerated from scratch, which harms performance.

Enabling this option will:
1. Cause the game to put a message in your game log notifying you about these container desyncs.
2. Log additional information in the Developer Tools console related to item movement.

Note that this option will impact performance when using drag and drop or stack/unstack on large numbers of items.
ui.menuOptionsDeveloperReportErrors: Send Errors to the Wayward Team
ui.menuOptionsDeveloperReportErrorsDescript: Allow the game to send certain error reports back to us. You can opt back out at any time. If you attempt to enable this, we'll give you more information on what gets sent and give you another chance to cancel.
ui.menuOptionsButtonSaveCompressionTooltip: Reduces the size of saves by up to 80%, at the cost of longer save and load times. Useful when space is limited.
ui.menuOptionsButtonSaveUIDataGlobally: Remember UI State for New Saves
ui.menuOptionsButtonSaveUIDataGloballyToolt: Enabling this allows newly created saves to re-use your previous games UI state (element/dialog positions) instead of the default state.
ui.menuPauseTooltipNotPaused: In multiplayer, the game does not pause unless the host has paused it.
ui.menuModesDescription: Configure game options associated with this save.
ui.menuMultiplayerOptionsOpenServerDescript: Allow players to join your game.
ui.menuMultiplayerOptionsCopyGameCodeToolti: Copy the game code to your clipboard. Share it with your friends to play together!
ui.menuMultiplayerOptionsCheckConnectionPar: Check if your network is configured properly. Visit the {(https://www.waywardgame.com/multiplayer):multiplayer page} on the Wayward website for more information. Only one of the following need to show as {#--COLOR-GOOD:green} for multiplayer to work.
ui.menuMultiplayerOptionsCheckConnectionRes: {#--COLOR-BAD:Unable to verify connection to the Steam Relay Network}.
{#--COLOR-BAD:The Steam Relay Network is not available}.
ui.menuJoinServerInputPlaceholder: Game Code, IP Address, or Hostname
ui.menuJoinServerChooseModifiersDescription: Enable and disable benefits and challenges.
ui.menuSharedMultiplayerChoiceLobbyTypeFrie: Anyone may be invited to the server, and the game will be visible and joinable to your friends.
ui.menuSharedMultiplayerChoiceLobbyTypePubl: The game will be visible and joinable for anyone.
ui.menuSharedMultiplayerChoiceLobbyTypePriv: The only way for players to join the game is to be invited.
ui.menuSharedMultiplayerChoicePVPDescriptio: Allow players to attack each other.
ui.menuSharedMultiplayerChoiceAllowTravelin: Allow players to travel to other islands.
ui.menuSharedMultiplayerChoiceAllowHardcore: Allow players to respawn in "Hardcore Mode" as a new character when they die.
ui.menuSharedMultiplayerChoicePauseOnDesync: Pauses the game when a multiplayer client is disconnected due to a desync.
ui.menuSharedRealTimeTickSpeedTooltip: The time it takes for a tick to occur in real-time mode.
